thread.title: Construction begins on Badger Mountain trailhead parking area
thread.title_full: Construction begins on Badger Mountain trailhead parking area

author: Tri-City Herald
title: Construction begins on Badger Mountain trailhead parking area
text:
October 5, 2015 Construction begins on Badger Mountain trailhead parking area Officials broke ground Monday for a new 50-space parking lot at Trailhead Park for the Badger Mountain hiking trails in Richland. More than 200,000 visits were recorded last year on the 1,600-foot mountain, making it one of the most hiked mountains in the state. Lack of parking leads many visitors to park on Queensgate Drive, causing problems for residents. Bob Brawdy/Tri-City Herald i Order Reprint of this Story 
Officials broke ground Monday for a new parking lot at Trailhead Park for the Badger Mountain hiking trails in Richland. 
More than 200,000 visits were recorded last year on the 1,600-foot mountain that has four official trails. That makes Badger one of the most hiked mountains in the state. 
Currently, there is one paved parking lot and one dirt lot with about 30 to 40 parking spaces, depending on how closely vehicles park. 
Thatâ€™s not enough to meet demand and leads many visitors to park on Queensgate Drive, causing problems for residents. 
The new lot will add about 50 spaces. Related content
